Good Morning, Bonjour, Guten Tag, Readers, the media spotlight in investment circles has focussed on the big banks this week, particularly what we call Bilk of America, which formerly was the largest bank in the United States. Holliday, Jr. Holliday has no banking or financial background of which we are aware. Educationally, according to the DuPont Webbed-Site published several years ago, Mr. Holliday has only an undergraduate degree in "industrial engineering" from the U. of Tennessee, no earned advance degrees. DuPont can be characterised as one of the most unethical chemical enterprises on the globe in the 21st century with a long documented history of dirty-dealing and fraud-mongering. Evidence of lack of integrity includes criminal price-fixing, toxic Teflon chemical cover-ups, robbing Monsanto of superior patent-protected seed technology, FRAUD on the U. S. DIstrict Court hearing the Monsanto patent infringement case, as well as defrauding investors and the public as to DuPont lagging seed business and its phony right to "use" Monsanto's know-how, misrepresentation of DuPont medical products, breaking FDA rules, systematic lying about the toxic contamination of an entire town in West VA, Spelter, the tree-killing Imprelis consumer product fraud, BENLATE litigation fraud, numerous instances, worker-killing SHAM SAFETY in cost-slashed, decaying DuPont factories and cooking OSHA books, undsoweiter. Topic.Title: God will punish with hell fire all that discriminate on his gay or lesbian children ! We are all Gods children !

Message.Msg: Leviticus 18 is a chapter of the Biblical book of Leviticus. According to the Hebrew Bible, it narrates part of the instructions given to Moses by God on Mount Sinai. The chapter deals with a number of sexual activities considered 'unclean' or 'abominable'. Although the chapter is principally concerned with incest, it also contains laws related to #$%$ and "lying with a man as with a woman." This single reference in verse 22 has, in recent years, made the interpretation of this verse a focus of debate among Christians and Jews regarding homosexual activity (see Homosexuality and Christianity and Jewish views of homosexuality). Leviticus 18 is generally regarded as part of the holiness code of Leviticus 11–26, and its sexual prohibitions are largely paralleled by Leviticus 20 (except that chapter has more emphasis on punishment).

Topic.Title: Jesus was and is a Socialist who shares the wealth and condemns coveting ! Ayn Rand burns in hell fire right now !

Message.Msg: Each of the three times when Jesus specifically mentions tithing, it is as a reprimand to the Pharisees. In Luke 11:42 he says, "But woe to you Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and all manner of herbs, and pass by justice and the love of God. These you ought to have done, without leaving the others undone." In Matthew 23:23, which includes the comment from Luke, additional words are reported and Jesus declares that the Pharisees are omitting the greater parts of the law, which are judgment, mercy, and faith. He addresses the issue of Pharisees and tithing once more in Luke 18:12, by telling a parable in which the Pharisee brags, "I fast twice in the week, I give tithes of all that I possess." Jesus ends the parable by saying "Everyone that exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted."

Topic.Title: Jesus was and is a Socialist who shares the wealth and condemns coveting ! Ayn Rand burns in hell fire right now !

Message.Msg: Old Testament, found in Malachi 3:8-10: 8. ""Will a man rob God? Yet you rob me. "But you ask, `How do we rob you?' "In tithes and offerings. 9. You are under a curse--the whole nation of you--because you are robbing me. 10. Bring the whole tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in my house. Test me in this," says the LORD Almighty, "and see if I will not throw open the floodgates of heaven and pour out so much blessing that you will not have room enough for it. Many preachers shorten Malachi 3:8-10 to just "Bring the whole tithe into the storehouse", and almost always with the inference that their church is the "storehouse". For purposes of this paper, the Lord had me concentrate on the passage: "Bring the whole tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in my house". From that passage, the Lord had me research several questions: 1) What is the tithe? 1) What is the tithe? The tithe is 10% of the increase, established in Leviticus 27:30-33 as an offering Holy to the Lord. The scripture identifies the tithe as grain and fruit, herd and flock. The tithe is food! An example of the tithe can be seen in a shepherd with a flock of 100 sheep who is blessed with the birth of 50 lambs in the spring. Five of the lambs must be offered to the Lord as a tithe. The tithe was brought to the temple in Jerusalem in acknowledgement and appreciation of God’s provision for His people.

Topic.Title: why the drop...serious reply only please

Message.Msg: InsideMonkey website is reporting that: "Shares of Bank of America Corp (NYSE:BAC), however, are down a whopping 1.7%. B of A's decline today is perhaps related to an internal issue. Bloomberg reported this morning that Derek DeVries, who was the acting head of European bank equity research at Bank of America's Merrill Lynch unit in London, is no longer with the firm. Bloomberg News received this information via an email sent to clients, and the news outlet reported that DeVries couldn't be contacted. DeVries held a top position with Merrill Lynch, and it seems odd that news of his departure would not have been made public by the company. While I am totally speculating here, the sudden unannounced departure may be the result of a trading mishap or a poor decision that could ultimately hurt Bank of America Corp"

Message.Title: Reason for drop?
Message.Msg: Shares of Bank of America Corp (NYSE:BAC), however, are down a whopping 1.7%. B of A's decline today is perhaps related to an internal issue. Bloomberg reported this morning that Derek DeVries, who was the acting head of European bank equity research at Bank of America's Merrill Lynch unit in London, is no longer with the firm. Bloomberg News received this information via an email sent to clients, and the news outlet reported that DeVries couldn't be contacted. DeVries held a top position with Merrill Lynch, and it seems odd that news of his departure would not have been made public by the company. While I am totally speculating here, the sudden unannounced departure may be the result of a trading mishap or a poor decision that could ultimately hurt Bank of America Corp (NYSE:BAC).

Message.Title: We just can't let rednecks be elected county sheriff
Message.Msg: PITTSBURGH (AP) – A county sheriff threatened to cut off the hands of a political campaign worker, pulled a gun on a newspaper reporter and then intimidated underlings and other witnesses so they wouldn't confirm the encounters to journalists and investigators, police and prosecutors said Monday. Beaver County Sheriff George David delivered expletive-fueled rants and uttered a racial slur to his alleged victims, according to a nine-page grand jury report supporting the charges. "Shake my hand. I'll cut your ... hands off and I'll eat them. I'll cut your hands off," David told a Democratic campaign worker whom the sheriff believed had spoken ill about him behind his back, according to the grand jury. David, a 65-year-old Democrat from Aliquippa, was arrested Monday at his office in Beaver, about 25 miles northwest of Pittsburgh, and arraigned by a district judge who set a preliminary hearing April 1. He was charged with simple assault, witness intimidation, terroristic threats, reckless endangerment, official oppression and obstructing the administration of law.

Message.Title: North Dakota introduces toughest abortion law in US
Message.Msg: North Dakota has banned abortion once a fetal heartbeat can be detected - as early as six weeks - in the most restrictive law of its kind in the US. Governor Jack Dalrymple signed a second law banning abortions based on genetic abnormalities. He approved a third law requiring doctors who perform abortions to have hospital-admitting privileges. Correspondents say the laws are in part an effort to close the state's only abortion clinic, in the town of Fargo. The measures, which take effect on August 1st, make no exceptions for rape, incest or the health of the mother. Gov Dalrymple said: "Although the likelihood of this measure surviving a court challenge remains in question, this bill is nevertheless a legitimate attempt by a state legislature to discover the boundaries of Roe v Wade."

Topic.Title: North Dakota introduces toughest abortion law in US

Message.Msg: In March, the state of Arkansas, former home of Bill Clinton, enacted tough abortion laws banning the procedure after 12 weeks of pregnancy.

Message.Title: Countdown to Judge Bransten Successor Liability within 30 days...
Message.Msg: the question to BAC's successor liability is easily answered: 1) BAC's Purchase Price took into account Countrywide's contingent liabilities, and BAC has been Paying them, 2) they have acknowledged that BAC's Income will go towards reserving for and paying CW contingent liabilities, and 3) Countrywide's Employees went to work for BAC. In addition, BAC Article 77 proceedings with suffer greatly as a result of a summary judgment against them on successor liability.

Topic.Title: BAC)’s Missing Out on the Dow’s Gains

Message.Msg: because they are very close to losing a summary judgment on successor liability. This will in turn have some very negative implications on their Article 77 proceedings and 8.5Billion dollar settlement. The end result could be about 4x....

Topic.Title: BAC)’s Missing Out on the Dow’s Gains

Message.Msg: It's because Reuters has reported that Warren Buffett will be exercising his Goldman Sachs warrants, meaning new shares. This may indicate that Buffett may also exercise his BoFA warrants from the $5B preferred shares he acquired that came with the 700M new shares at $7.50 (?), which means the recent $5B buyback of common shares that was announced will get eaten up by Buffett's new shares if it goes through and that is why the PPS has dropped today following the announcement.

Topic.Title: So does the Goldman/Buffet share conversion equal bad news for BAC?

Message.Msg: Agree. No reason for Buffett to convert this set now. We are now being strengthened by share buy back. Less shares, better PPS. GL.

Topic.Title: BAC)’s Missing Out on the Dow’s Gains

Message.Msg: He cannot tell you the source because what he says is NOT true. I've been following the case between MBIA and BoFA very closely and Vlad is an MBIA investor. MBIA is currently being sued by BoFA and Societe Generale on fraud for splitting the insurance company of transferring $5B out of reach of policy holders through so-called restructuring. Besides, BoFA has taken a great pain to keep Countrywide as a separate company. Those steps include using their own separate accounting systems and profit-and-loss statements for Countrywide units. If the litigation gets out of hand and dragging down the parent company BoFA will use its nuclear option to put Countrywide into a bankruptcy with BoFA falling under the Limited Liability clause where the parent company is not responsible for the debt of an acquired company. [Bank of America Corp. (BAC), the lender burdened by its Countrywide Financial Corp. takeover, would consider putting the unit into bankruptcy if litigation losses threaten to cripple the parent, said four people with knowledge of the firm’s strategy. A Countrywide bankruptcy could halt legal proceedings and consolidate litigation into one court that would split up the subsidiary’s remaining assets for creditors, said Jay Westbrook, a law professor at the University of Texas at Austin.] –Bloomberg

Topic.Title: BAC)’s Missing Out on the Dow’s Gains

Message.Msg: Why Bank of America Will Lose on Successor Liability It is important to keep in mind what are the relevant facts and legal arguments when considering whether MBIA will be granted summary judgement (SJ) on its motion that Bank of America (BAC) has successor liability for the liabilities of Countrywide. MBIA's principal argument is that on the facts of the case, BAC has successor liability for Countrywide's liabilities based on the New York law of de facto merger. De Facto merger is one of the few exceptions to the corporate law principle that an acquiror of assets (BAC) doesn't thereby also acquire the transferor's (Countrywide's) liabilities. Another separate and distinct exception to this corporate law principle of non-successor liability is the theory of fraudulent conveyance. BAC's counsel misstated the legal parameters of the de facto merger doctrine and emphasized irrelevant facts in its argument before Justice Bransten by trying to conflate the theory of de facto merger (which requires no analysis of the consideration received in connection with a transfer of assets) with the separate theory of fraudulent conveyance (which is all about whether assets were transferred for less than full value). Since the facts of the case don't support the theory of fraudulent conveyance as easily and neatly as they support the theory of de facto merger, BAC essentially defended against MBIA's claim of de facto merger by arguing that there was no fraudulent conveyance. This may be true, but it is quite beside the point. I do not believe that Justice Bransten will be confused by BAC's attempt to conjure lemonade from lemons. I use this euphemism because it appeared that BAC went to great length to conduct its acquisition of Countrywide in a way such that it would acquire all of the operating assets and business (including management) of Countrywide (the Countrywide mortgage platform), and insulate itself from liabilities it did not want to assume (or which BAC would agr

Topic.Title: BAC)’s Missing Out on the Dow’s Gains

Message.Msg: [And BAC has already lost their case concerning MBI restructuring in NY supreme court and will have the same fate during appeals.] I think not. I think the judge had made some errors in her judgement. In order for the system to work the Law has to be precise and in this case MBIA did accept the payments in premium regularly from their policy holders even after launching their lawsuit against BoFA. Now, isn’t that being a bit disingenuous because by cashing the checks on the premium effectively MBIA would have forfeited their claims on any fraud allegations? The judge should have realized this in my opinion..

Topic.Title: BAC)’s Missing Out on the Dow’s Gains

Message.Msg: Aren’t you counting the chickens before they hatch? It seems to me BoFA would have considered settling with MBIA long before if BoFA believed that they would lose. It is now obvious to anyone that BoFA intents to see this matter through right to the end in a trial. Reportedly, BoFA has been fortifying with attorneys specialize in trials suggest to me that BoFA is very confident that they will win the case otherwise BoFA would have settled.
